Definition: Project name
List the person who should be contacted by users seeking further information for the data. Only one contact is allowed. Including the ORCID of this individual is strongly encouraged.
List the name and contact details of the Pilot in Command (PIC). Include FAA pilot license number if applicable.
Geographic place name, including Place, State, Country
Identifiers of any sites or plots within flight area
Date of first flight in data package
Date of last flight in data package
Total number of flights for which data included
Average flight time of missions
Total flight time of missions (alternative to using numFlights and flightTimeAvg)
List land permits, waivers and Certificates of Waiver or Authorization (COA). Can include documents in the data package.

Base station GPS coordinates, model and type of GNSS data collected. Self-deployed vs CORS network station. If CORS record ID of CORS station(s) (e.g. AB11) and provide raw base station data in data submission.
Geospatial reference system used
Manufacturer and model of airframe
Type of airframe
Maximum takeoff gross weight of system including airframe
Platform serial number
Platform registration details, e.g. FAA registration number
Manufacturer and model of motor types
Manufacturer and model of propellor types
Manufacturer and model of flight controller
Battery type (cells, peak voltage, connectors)
Manufacturer and model of gimbal types
GPS make/model and supported GNSS modes
Inertial Measurement Unit model
Manufacturer and model of radios
Manufacturer and model of handheld remote control
Indicate if photos or diagrams showing the platform and payload configuration are included in the data package.
Individual flight identifier
Site name
Start of flight date and time
End of flight date and time
Boundary of flight area
Flight height program setting, indicate AGL (above ground level) or AMSL (height above average mean sea level)
Forward overlap program setting
Side overlap program setting
Flight speed program setting
Summary of wind speed, temperature, cloud cover
Descriptor of light quality during flight
Descriptor of light type during flight
Estimate of percentage cloud cover during flight
Dominant cloud cover type during flight
Descriptor of surface moisture conditions
Days since last rain event
Type of sensing system
Manufacturer and model of sensor
Instrument serial number
Date of last calibration
Specifications of the foreoptic used for data collection. A foreoptic could be an optical lens, a fiber optic, a combined fiber optic+lens, etc. Include serial numbers if applicable.
Image size in pixels
Camera shutter speed. Can be fixed for all flights or a range of values if variable.
Instrument focal length
The instrument field of view. For LiDAR specify horizontal and vertical FOV
ISO light sensitivity setting. Can be fixed for all flights or a range of values if variable.
Camera focus setting. List all that were used
Camera white balance settings used. List all settings used during campaign.
Image bit depth
Sensor output file format
The measurement units output by the sensor
Instrument/sensor measurement accuracy as per manufacturer specifications
Instrument/sensor measurement precision as per manufacturer specifications
Instrument sensitivity as per manufacturer specifications. The smallest difference between two features that is detectable by the sensor.
Measurement frame rate or speed
Indicate if spectral response functions are included in data package
Measurement integration time. Can be fixed value or range.
Instrument measurement wavelength range. Can be more than one if a co-aligned instrument
Instrument measurement resolution. Can be more than one if a co-aligned instrument
Make/Model of GNSS Inertial Measurement Unit used with the sensing system
For each sensor plus combined
The fixed or selected aperture size for the data collection
Weight of sensor
Lidar beam wavelength
The total number of LiDAR channels (laser beams) used for data collection
Max measurement distance
Angular resolution of LiDAR system (Vertical)
Angular Resolution (Horizontal/Azimuth):
